title: 113_hr1908
content: The Act may be cited as the "Federal Repeal of Expensive Exchanges Act" or the "FREE Act". The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act increases healthcare costs, drives up the Federal deficit, and limits accessibility. It imposes a Federal mandate on health insurance exchanges, undermining States' authority and imposing additional costs on consumers and States. The Federal mandate in the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act undermines choice and competition in health insurance markets, leading to further consolidation. Repeal of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act premium tax credits and cost-sharing subsidies. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act are amended by removing sections related to premium tax credits, cost-sharing reductions, and conforming amendments. The Internal Revenue Code and the Affordable Care Act are amended to remove sections related to premium tax credits and cost-sharing reductions. Section 6103(l)(21) of the Code is also amended to update definitions and remove certain references. The Internal Revenue Code and the Affordable Care Act are amended to update definitions and remove certain references. Section 6211(b)(4)(A) of the Code is amended to define 'modified adjusted gross income' for tax purposes. The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to update certain sections and redesignate paragraphs. The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to update sections and redesignate paragraphs. Title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act is also amended to make specific changes. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended by removing certain paragraphs related to premium tax credits and cost-sharing reductions. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended by removing paragraphs related to premium tax credits and cost-sharing reductions. This includes changes in various sections such as 1311, 1312, and 1313. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended by removing paragraphs related to premium tax credits, cost-sharing reductions, and expensive exchanges. This includes changes in sections 1331, 1332, and 1334. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended by removing certain clauses related to premium tax credits, cost-sharing reductions, and exchanges. This includes changes in sections 1401, 1411, and 18081. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to adjust eligibility requirements for enrollment through the Exchange by verifying applicant information under subsections (c) and (d). This includes removing clauses related to premium tax credits and cost-sharing reductions. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to adjust eligibility requirements for enrollment through the Exchange by verifying applicant information under subsections (c) and (d). This includes removing clauses related to premium tax credits and cost-sharing reductions in various sections. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to adjust eligibility requirements for enrollment through the Exchange by verifying applicant information. This includes removing clauses related to premium tax credits and cost-sharing reductions in various sections of the Act. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to adjust eligibility requirements for enrollment through the Exchange by verifying applicant information. This includes removing clauses related to premium tax credits and cost-sharing reductions in various sections of the Act, such as modifying language regarding health assistance and premium credit assistance eligibility. SEC. 4. REPEAL OF EMPLOYER AND INDIVIDUAL MANDATES. The text discusses the repeal of the employer mandate in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, specifically amending sections 4980H and 6056. Additionally, changes are made to section 6724(d) regarding information returns. The text discusses amendments to the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, including changes to section 1332(a)(2)(D) and section 1513. Additionally, the repeal of the Individual Health Insurance Mandate under Section 5000A of the Internal Revenue Code is addressed. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to terminate the Individual Health Insurance Mandate under Section 5000A of the Internal Revenue Code after December 31, 2013. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to Section 1311(d)(4) of the Act. These amendments are effective as if included in the original sections they relate to.
